history.proof: intros H. qsimpl time: 1 use: trans_eeq. qsimpl time: 1 use: trans_eeq. - intros x y Hxy. apply union_incl. intros i. specialize (H i). destruct H as [H1' H2]. qsimpl time: 1 use: trans_eeq. sfirstorder depth: 3use: trans_eeq, union_incl. - intros x y Hxy. qsimpl time: 1 use: trans_eeq,union_incl. qsimpl time: 1 use: trans_eeq,union_incl. qsimpl time: 1 use: trans_eeq,union_incl. sfirstorder depth: 3use: trans_eeq, union_incl.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
Z: Type
Y: Type
X: Type
I: Type
R1': relation2 X Y
R': relation2 X Y
S': relation2 Y Z
R1: relation2 X Y
R: relation2 X Y
S: relation2 Y Z
T: relation X
T': relation X
F: I -> relation2 X Y
F': I -> relation2 X Y

Goal:
(forall i : I, eeq (F i) (F' i)) -> eeq (union F) (union F')

Premises:
eeq : forall X Y : Type, relation (relation2 X Y)
union : forall X Y I : Type, (I -> X -> Y -> Prop) -> relation2 X Y
relation2 = fun X Y : Type => X -> Y -> Prop : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments relation2 (_ _)%type_scope
relation = fun X : Type => relation2 X X : Type -> Type Arguments relation _%type_scope
union_incl : (forall i : I, incl (F i) (F' i)) -> incl (union F) (union F')
ssrbool.onPhantom : forall (P : ?T -> Prop) (x : ?T), ssreflect.phantom Prop (P x) where ?T : [I : Type X : Type Y : Type Z : Type R' : relation2 X Y R1' : relation2 X Y S' : relation2 Y Z R : relation2 X Y R1 : relation2 X Y S : relation2 Y Z T' : relation X T : relation X F' : I -> relation2 X Y F : I -> relation2 X Y |- Type]
comp : forall X Y Z : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y Z -> relation2 X Z
union2 : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y
eta2 : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y
trans : forall X Y : Type, relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y X
union_st : forall X Y : Type, set (relation2 X Y) -> X -> Y -> Prop
plus : forall X : Type, relation X -> relation X
incl : forall X Y : Type, relation (relation2 X Y)
star_ind : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (P : X -> X -> Prop), (forall x : X, P x x) -> (forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x x0 : X, star R x x0 -> P x x0
star_sind : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (P : X -> X -> SProp), (forall x : X, P x x) -> (forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x x0 : X, star R x x0 -> P x x0
antisymmetric : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
symmetric : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
transitive : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
reflexive : forall X : Type, relation X -> Prop
comp_eeq = fun (H : (forall (x : X) (y : Y), R x y -> R' x y) /\ (forall (x : X) (y : Y), R' x y -> R x y)) (H0 : (forall (x : Y) (y : Z), S x y -> S' x y) /\ (forall (x : Y) (y : Z), S' x y -> S x y)) => and_ind (fun (H1 : forall (x : X) (y : Y), R x y -> R' x y) (H2 : forall (x : X) (y : Y), R' x y -> R x y) => and_ind (fun (H3 : forall (x : Y) (y : Z), S x y -> S' x y) (H4 : forall (x : Y) (y : Z), S' x y -> S x y) => conj (fun (x : X) (y : Z) (H5 :...
set = fun X : Type => X -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments set _%type_scope
trans_eeq = fun H : incl R R' /\ incl R' R => and_ind (fun (H0 : incl R R') (H1 : incl R' R) => conj (fun (x : Y) (y : X) (H2 : trans R x y) => H0 y x H2) (fun (x : Y) (y : X) (H2 : trans R' x y) => H1 y x H2)) H : eeq R R' -> eeq (trans R) (trans R')
Inductive star (X : Type) (R : relation X) : relation X := star_refl : forall x : X, star R x x | S_star : forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z Arguments star [X]%type_scope Arguments star_refl [X]%type_scope Arguments S_star [X]%type_scope [R y] _ [z]
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : BinNums.Z | Zpos : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z | Zneg : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinNums.Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments BinNums.Zneg _%positive_scope
Ring_theory.mkmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), req (phi cO) rO -> req (phi cI) rI -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y))) -> (forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y))) ->...-> Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi
ssreflect.external_view_ind : forall P : ssreflect.external_view -> Prop, (forall T : Type, P (ssreflect.tactic_view T)) -> forall e : ssreflect.external_view, P e
BinInt.Z.le_ind : forall A : BinNums.Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall n : BinNums.Z, A n -> (forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m -> A m -> A (BinInt.Z.succ m)) -> forall m : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le n m -> A m
Field_theory.gen_phiPOS_inj : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> (forall x y : R, req (radd rI x) (radd rI y) -> req x y) -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, ~ req (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS1 rI radd rmul p) rO) -> forall x y : BinNums.positive, req (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS rI radd rmul x) (InitialRing.gen_phiPOS rI radd rmul y) -> x = y
BinNat.N.lt_ind : forall A : BinNums.N -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall n : BinNums.N, A (BinNat.N.succ n) -> (forall m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.lt n m -> A m -> A (BinNat.N.succ m)) -> forall m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.lt n m -> A m

```coq
intros H.
apply trans_eeq.
split.
- intros x y Hxy.
  apply union_incl.
  intros i.
  specialize (H i).
  destruct H as [H1 H2].
  split; intros Hyx; apply H1; apply H2; assumption.
- intros x y Hxy.
  apply union_incl.
  intros i.
  specialize (H i).
  destruct H as [H1 H2].
  split; intros Hyx; apply H2; apply H1; assumption.
Qed.

original: intros H. apply trans_eeq. split. - intros x y Hxy. apply union_incl. intros i. specialize (H i). destruct H as [H1 H2]. split; intros Hyx; apply H1; apply H2; auto. - intros x y Hxy. apply union_incl. intros i. specialize (H i). destruct H as [H1 H2]. split; intros Hyx; apply H2; apply H1; auto.
